title: How to Make Someone an Admin on a Facebook Page

steps.title: Open the Facebook mobile app.
steps.content: Open the Facebook mobile app. It's the blue icon with a white "F" on your Home screen or app list. Many older pages still have the Classic Pages Experience, an older-style layout, while others now have the New Pages Experience. If you don’t see the same options as below, see this method instead. In the new Pages experience, "Admin" is replaced with "full control." Giving someone full control allows them to perform all administrative tasks, including adding/removing admins, changing permissions, and deleting the Page. If you don't want to give full control, you can give partial control or also assign specific tasks like content creation, ads, insights, community activity (moderation), or messages and calls.

steps.title: Go to your Page.
steps.content: Go to your Page. Here's a simple way to get there: Tap the menu icon, which you'll see at the bottom-right corner on an iPhone/iPad, or at the top-right on an Android. It may have your profile picture. Tap the down arrow next to your name at the top. Tap the page you want to assign an admin role to.

steps.title: Tap the profile icon or ☰.
steps.content: Tap the profile icon or ☰ . It's the icon with your page's profile image or an outline of a person inside of a circle. On iPhone, tap the icon with three lines at the bottom of the screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings & privacy . It's near the bottom of the profile menu. This expands the Settings & privacy options.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's the first option that appears under "Settings & privacy" when you expand that menu.

steps.title: Tap Page setup.
steps.content: Tap Page setup . It's below the "Audience and visibility" header. It's next to an icon that resembles a flag.

steps.title: Tap View next to "Page access."
steps.content: Tap View next to "Page access." This displays a list of people with roles on the Page, including current Admins, Editors, and Moderators. If you want to change someone's access from partial to full control, tap the three dots next to the person's name, select Edit Access , change their control access, and then tap Update Access .

steps.title: Tap Add New.
steps.content: Tap Add New . It's next to "People with Facebook access." Some information about roles will appear. Alternatively, if you want to give someone partial access to your Facebook page, tap Add new next to "People with task access" instead.

steps.title: Tap Next.
steps.content: Tap Next . It's the blue button at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Type the name or email address of the person you want to add.
steps.content: Type the name or email address of the person you want to add. If you type someone's name, a list of search results will appear—tap the person you want to add when you see them.

steps.title: Tap the switch to give the user full control.
steps.content: Tap the switch to give the user full control. The switch will turn blue, which means you'll be giving that person total administrative access to the Page. If you are assigning some task access, tap the toggle switches next to the roles you want to allow them to have access to.

steps.title: Tap Give Access.
steps.content: Tap Give Access . You'll be asked to confirm your password. Once confirmed, the selected user will receive an email invitation to manage the Page. Once they accept the invitation, they'll have full control. To accept the invitation, the person can click the link in the email message they receive from Facebook or tap the notification in Facebook.

steps.title: Go to your Facebook Page in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to your Facebook Page in a web browser. In the new Pages experience, "Admin" is replaced with "full control." Giving someone full control allows them to perform all administrative tasks, including adding/removing admins, changing permissions, and deleting the Page. To get to your Page, click your profile icon, select See all profiles , and select your Page. Many older pages still have the Classic Pages Experience, which is an older-style layout, while others now have the New Pages Experience. If you don’t see the same options as below, see this method instead. However, the classic pages experience will be upgraded to new pages very soon. If you don't want to give full control, you can give them partial control over your Facebook page. You can also assign them specific tasks, such as content creation, ads, insights, community activity (moderation), or messages and calls.

steps.title: Open the Settings menu.
steps.content: Open the Settings menu. You can either click Settings in the menu bar on the left or click your profile icon at the top-right and select Settings & privacy > Settings .

steps.title: Click View next to "Page access."
steps.content: Click View next to "Page access." . Now you'll see a list of people who have full or partial control of the Page already. If you want to promote someone who already has partial control to full admin control, click the three dots next to that person's name, choose Edit Access , switch to full control, and then tap Update Access .

steps.title: Click Add New.
steps.content: Click Add New . It's next to "People with Facebook Access." Alternatively, if you want to give someone partial access to your Facebook page, click Add new next to "People with task access" task access instead.

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next .

steps.title: Select the person you want to give an admin role to.
steps.content: Select the person you want to give an admin role to. Type the name or email address of the person you want to add, then click the correct person in the search results.

steps.title: Scroll down and click the switch to give full control.
steps.content: Scroll down and click the switch to give full control. The switch will turn blue. Alternatively, if you are assigning someone task access, click the toggle switch next to the roles you want them to have access to.

steps.title: Click Give Access.
steps.content: Click Give Access . When prompted, you'll be asked to type your Facebook password to confirm the change. Once confirmed, Facebook will send an email invitation to the new admin. Once the person accepts the admin invitation, they'll have full administrative control over the Page. To accept the invitation, the person can click the link in the email message they receive from Facebook or tap the notification in Facebook.

steps.title: Go to your Page in the Facebook mobile app.
steps.content: Go to your Page in the Facebook mobile app. Tap the menu icon, which you'll see at the bottom-right corner on an iPhone/iPad, or at the top-right on an Android, tap the down arrow next to your name, then select your Page. Facebook will soon be upgrading classic pages to the new page experience. If the steps in this method don't work for you, use this method instead.

steps.title: Tap the profile icon or ☰.
steps.content: Tap the profile icon or ☰ . It's the icon with your page's profile image or an outline of a person inside of a circle. On iPhone, tap the icon with three lines at the bottom of the screen. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings & privacy . It's near the bottom of the profile menu.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's the first option that appears under "Settings & privacy" when you expand that menu.

steps.title: Tap Page Roles.
steps.content: Tap Page Roles . It's about halfway down the list of options. You'll see a list of people who have assigned rights (including Moderator and Editor) for the Page, as well as the option to add new people.

steps.title: Tap Add Person to Page.
steps.content: Tap Add Person to Page . It's at the top of the screen. If you want to promote someone to Admin who already has an assigned role, such as Editor or Moderator, just tap the pencil next to the person's name, select Admin from the list, and then tap Save .

steps.title: Select the person you want to make an admin.
steps.content: Select the person you want to make an admin. Start typing the name of the person you want to add, then tap the correct person when they appear in the search results. This displays a page that allows you to assign roles to that user.

steps.title: Tap Admin.
steps.content: Tap Admin . The checkmark will move to the Admin option.

steps.title: Tap Add.
steps.content: Tap Add . If prompted, confirm your password to complete the role assignment. Once confirmed, the selected user will have full administrative rights on the Page. To accept the invitation, the person can click the link in the email message they receive from Facebook or tap the notification in Facebook.

steps.title: Go to your Facebook Page.
steps.content: Go to your Facebook Page. To get there, click your profile icon at the top-right corner, select See all profiles , and click the Page you want to assign an admin role for. Facebook will soon be upgrading classic pages to the new Page experience. If the steps in this method don't work for you, use this method instead.

steps.title: Open the Settings menu.
steps.content: Open the Settings menu. You can either click Settings in the menu bar to the left, or click your profile icon and go to Settings & privacy > Settings .

steps.title: Click Page Roles.
steps.content: Click Page Roles . This opens a page that displays the current Admins, Editors, Moderators, Advertisers, and Analysts for the page. If you want to promote someone to Admin who already has an assigned role, such as Editor or Moderator, just click the drop-down menu next to that person's name and select Admin from the list and then click Save .

steps.title: Type the name or email address of the person you want to add.
steps.content: Type the name or email address of the person you want to add. If you want to add someone who you are already friends with, you can start typing that person's name into the field and then select the correct person from the search results. If you want to add someone by email address, you can type the person's email address into the field instead. This allows you to send an invitation via email.

steps.title: Select Admin from the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Select Admin from the drop-down menu. The menu is to the right of the typing area.

steps.title: Click the blue Add button.
steps.content: Click the blue Add button. You may have to enter your own password to confirm. This will give the selected person full administrative rights to the Page. To accept the invitation, the person can click the link in the email message they receive from Facebook or tap the notification in Facebook.
